The teenage singing star: Lorde

Ella Marija Lani Yelich-O’Connor is a talented singer and songwriter from New Zealand. She chose her stage name – Lorde – for her interest in kings, queens, and royal families from the past. As a child, she was much more intelligent than her classmates. She showed great talent in music and performing from a young age. At 16, her first song Royals was a huge success around the world. It made her the youngest artist in 25 years to have a number-one song in the USA. With this song, Lorde won two Grammy Awards, becoming one of the youngest Grammy winners ever. She continued her success with songs that talk about problems and emotions that teenagers experience every day.

 

The musical prodigy*: Alma Deutscher

Alma Deutscher, born in 2005 in England, is a young girl with an amazing talent for music. People believe she is as good as the famous composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. She started playing the piano at 2 and the violin at 3. When she was 7, she wrote her first piano piece, and at 10, she created her first opera, Cinderella. In Alma’s version, Cinderella doesn’t lose her shoe. Instead, she sings a beautiful song before leaving the ball. It’s with that song that the prince finds her again. Alma has written many other pieces of music and organised competitions for young musicians. Alma enjoys reading; she loves biographies about scientists and composers.

 

The young ballet sensation: Michaela DePrince

Michaela DePrince was born in Sierra Leone during the war. She lost her parents and grew up in an orphanage. Her life there was difficult because she had a skin condition called vitiligo. It's when a person’s skin starts to lose its color in some places. At 4, she saw a magazine photo of a ballerina and dreamed of becoming a dancer. When she was adopted by an American family, Michaela moved to the USA. She started ballet training and she joined the Dance Theatre of Harlem at 13. By the age of 17, she became a professional dancer with the Dutch National Ballet. Michaela danced in famous performances like The Nutcracker and Swan Lake.

 

VOCABULARY: *prodigy – Wunderkind
